Function Documentation

VLIB_STATUS VLIB_calcConnectedComponentsMaxBufferSize ( int16_t  imgWidth,
int16_t  imgHeight,
int32_t  minArea,
int32_t *  maxbytesRequired 
)

Description:
This function estimates the upper bound of the buffer size required for the connected components list based on image dimensions and minimum blob area inputs.
Parameters:
[in] imgWidth Input width (SQ15.0)
[in] imgHeight Input height (SQ15.0)
[in] minArea Min area (SQ31.0)
[out] *maxbytesRequired Bytes required (SQ31.0)

VLIB_STATUS VLIB_initConnectedComponentsList ( VLIB_CCHandle *  handle,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  bytes 
)

Description:
This function initializes the handle. It requires that the pBuf buffer has already been allocated with size of bytes.
Parameters:
[out] *handle pointer to CC handle
[in] *pBuf pointer to input buffer
[in] bytes bytes (SQ31.0)

VLIB_STATUS VLIB_createConnectedComponentsList ( VLIB_CCHandle *  handle,
uint16_t  width,
uint16_t  height,
uint32_t *  pIn32BitPacked,
int32_t  minBlobArea,
int32_t  connected8Flag 
)

Description:
This is the primary function for grouping and labeling foreground components or blobs in the pIn32BitPacked image. The results are internally stored within the handle, and can be accessed using the helper functions: VLIB_getNumCCs and VLIB_getCCFeatures.
Parameters:
[in,out] *handle Pointer to CC handle
[in] width Input width (UQ16.0)
[in] height Input height (UQ16.0)
[in] *pIn32BitPacked Pointer to input
[in] minBlobArea Minimum Area (SQ31.0)
[in] connected8Flag Flag (SQ31.0)

VLIB_STATUS VLIB_getNumCCs ( VLIB_CCHandle *  handle,
int32_t *  numCCs 
)

Description:
After running VLIB_createConnectedComponentsList, the number of connected components (numCCs) can be obtained by passing the handle to this function.
Parameters:
[in] *handle Poimter to CC handle
[out] numCCs number of connected components (SQ31.0)

VLIB_STATUS VLIB_getCCFeatures ( VLIB_CCHandle *  handle,
VLIB_CC *  cc,
int16_t  listIndex 
)

Description:
After running VLIB_createConnectedComponentsList, a single connected component blob can be retrieved by passing the handle and index of the blob to this function. VLIB_getNumCCs can be run first in order to determine what the maximum supported value of listIndex is.
Parameters:
[in] *handle Pointer to CC handle
[out] *cc Pointer to CC
[in] listIndex Index (SQ15.0)
Assumptions:
  • Maximum supported listIndex is (numCCs - 1).

VLIB_STATUS VLIB_createCCMap8Bit ( VLIB_CCHandle *  handle,
uint8_t *restrict  pOutMap,
const uint16_t  outCols,
const uint16_t  outRows 
)

Description:
This function generates a blob map. For each pixel in the scene, the map assigns a unique index, which is associated with a particular blob. Unassociated pixels are labeled with index = 0. There are a maximum of 255 unique indices, e.g. blobs, in the map.
Parameters:
[in] *handle Pointer to CC handle
[out] *pOutMap Pointer to output data
[in] outCols Input Cols (UQ16.0)
[in] outRows Input Rows (UQ16.0)
Assumptions:
  • Maximum supported blob to label = 255 (due to bit width of each pixel in the blob map being 8 bits).
  • pOutMap is assumed to be double-word aligned and not aliased.

int32_t VLIB_GetSizeOfCCHandle ( void   ) 

Description:
This function returns the size of the CC Handle.
Returns:
Size of CC Handle in bytes
